Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Slapper \Slap"per\, Slapping \Slap"ping\, a. Very large; monstrous; big. [Slang.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Slap \Slap\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Slapped}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Slapping}.] To strike with the open hand, or with something broad. [1913 Webster]

slap n 1: a blow from a flat object (as an open hand) [syn: {smack}] 2: the act of smacking something; a blow delivered with an open hand [syn: {smack}, {smacking}] adv : directly; "he ran bang into the pole"; "ran slap into her" [syn: {bang}, {slapdash}, {smack}, {bolt}] v : hit with something flat, like a paddle or the open hand; "The impatient teacher slapped the student"; "a gunshot slapped him on the forehead" [also: {slapping}, {slapped}]
